The tension between conscience and canon, the need to preserve discipline while at the same time guarding against an authoritarianism that would make the law impervious to divine inspiration (what Pope Urban II had termed private law, or that law which is written in the heart by the inspiration of the Holy Spirit) was a continual theme in canonical literature
